revised_title: The Influence of Acidity and Alkalinity on the Swelling of Excised Muscle
tldr: The author investigates the effect of varying acidity and alkalinity on the swelling and behavior of excised frog muscles. They find that the greatest changes in muscle swelling occur near the neutral point, and that different buffer solutions affect the degree of swelling. The iso-electric point for muscle colloids is determined to be within the pH range of 5 to 7.
